name: Lake Crescent Lodge

reviews.text: This is an out of the way place on the edge of the Olympic National Park. Consists of some rooms in the lodge and for the most part cabins with nice bath and showers. No TV and no phones. Lodge itself has a bar and restaurant. Cheaper way to go is to eat in the bar area. WiFi is available in the main area of the lodge. Sits on the edge of the lake. Good place to stay while visiting some of the parks various attractions.
reviews.title: Old time lake side resort lodge

likes.liked: — Away from the hustle bustle of modern life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a small room in the main lodge. We had a great view of the lake and loved the wood paneling in the room. The bed was very comfortable. The room did not have a private bathroom but this was not much of a problem as we stayed only one night. The only negative was that you could hear noise from the neighboring rooms. However this was acceptable considering the $90 price we paid for the room.
reviews.title: pleasant stay in a spectacular setting

likes.disliked: — Lack of fresh local breads/pastries at breakfast

reviews.text: We also had a great seafood dinner at the restaurant. Staff recommended a very pleasant wine from a local winery - Harbinger - in Port Angeles.
reviews.title: Breath-taking scenery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was however disappointing. Would have liked freshly baked pastries and local breads and organic cereals and granolas.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed in Lake Cresent Lodge once before - about 10 years ago, and found the rooms and food significantly improved. We got to peek at the famous historic Roosevelt Cottages, and would love to stay there sometime!
reviews.title: Historic Beauty, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, this was truly a special treat. The location was gorgeous, the view spectacular, and the lodge itself was very cool. We didn't love our room, but my husband reminded me its a national park property (meaning don't expect luxury). It was clean and spacious, though. The bar and sun porch were just beautiful. We hiked up to a nearby waterall from the lodge which was so beautiful and we saw lots of deer. Food in the restaurant is quite good. I hope to visit again in the future but will probably try to get one of the fireplace cabins (which have better views that ours did).
reviews.title: Gorgeous location and beautiful lodge

reviews.text: It is a wonderful, almost magical place. I return every year. Various hikes are easily accessible and it is nice central location to explore the upper Olympic Peninsula, although it is hard to get away from the Lodge and Lake to do anything else.
reviews.title: A Magical Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped to enjoy the beauty of the lake and found ourselves enjoying a cold drink while sitting in an Adirondack chair and enjoying the lake views. Guests nearby were enjoying what looked like a lovely sandwich. It looked like a lovely hotel and they were most welcoming of those just dropping by for a drink or meal. It was a beautiful way to break up our sight seeing of the Olympic National Park.
reviews.title: We didn't stay but enjoyed the grounds!

reviews.text: The location is beautiful. The main lodge is really nice. The Marymere rooms are in bad need of updating, particularly the bathrooms. The service in the restaurant is painfully slow. Two hours to get through breakfast is too much.
reviews.title: Good for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know it is more expensive, but the Roosevelt Cabin was very worth it! We were the last cabin down on the end, and they are right on the water! There are huge windows overlooking the lake, and it was gorgeous! There were ducks that came to visit us every day, and one morning I woke up to see deer walking right by our window. It was so peaceful to sit inside or outside and admire the views.
reviews.title: Go for the Roosevelt Cabin!!

reviews.text: We so enjoyed staying here. The scenery and tranquility made our stay memorable. We stayed in the Marymere rooms... quite large, good beds, and 2 chairs outside our room to enjoy the beautiful view of the lake.. enjoyed having our Starbuck's coffee in our room! The walk to the lodge felt like we were at summer camp... the lake, the beach, the trees, the peace! We ate most of our meals at the lodge - both in the dining room and the veranda, inside and outside. Most of the food and service was wonderful... Last day the dining room was very understaffed, and we had to leave after waiting 1 hour for our breakfast. The hikes around the lodge were great - especially hike to Marymere falls. Loved the kayak tour of the lake and the evening campfires. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Lake Crescent Lodge was one of the highlights of our trip!!
reviews.title: Peaceful experience

reviews.text: My husband and I both have spent time traveling in Europe, and this year decided to stay in the US. We both enjoy being outdoors, hiking and just enjoying the environment. Staying at Lake Crescent Lodge was a wonderful experience for us, and by staying right in the park we were able to enjoy all of the beauty of the lake and other areas of the park. We spent 3 nights and filled each day with just enjoying the beautiful area. We met lots of friendly people which also made the time there relaxing. Would highly recommend it to friends and relatives.
reviews.title: Pure Beauty

reviews.text: Everything about Lake Crescent Lodge is the tops, from the staff to the accommodations to the food,to the true beauty of this incredible lake. Even the weather could not have been more perfect. A truly memorable experience. Thank you!
reviews.title: My favorite place ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lake Crescent Lodge is located in an area with unparalleled outside activities that are accessible and enjoyable for all members of the family. The peaceful location is the first plus. Swimming, boating, kayaking, all accessible and made simple, right there. I thought it would be loud at night with so many people, but the nights were peaceful and restful. We hiked to the waterfalls (close by and magnificent), through mossy rain forest trees, swam, played on the beach, dined on the restaurant food (wide variety of choices) on our patio porch while gazing at the lake and watched the grandkids play on the beach. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: We enjoyed our one night here

reviews.text: We booked a 2 room singer tavern cottage over Mother's Day Weekend and were delighted with our rooms. 3 queen beds in 2 rooms with an attached bathroom, all recently renovated and clean!! They are rustic (no tv or telephone) but you are here to sit on your porch and look out at the water. It was extremely relaxing. There is wi-fi in the lobby but it wasn't working the day we were there.
reviews.title: Cutest Little Cottage

likes.liked: — we were able to book a 2 room cottage, fun for family trip
likes.disliked: — bed was not the most comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the restaurant for dinner and it was LOVELY, our waiter was so friendly and added to our enjoyment of the meal. Yes, it was a little pricey but the food was of high quality, it wasn't like other resorts where you spend the money and then are mad about paying so much for a cheeseburger and fries. We ate salmon, halibut and an elk burger. All were delicious!
reviews.title: What a find!!

likes.liked: — Beautiful location and great end-of-season rate

reviews.text: I highly recommend the Lake Crescent Lodge, wish I could afford to stay there for a week!
reviews.title: wonderful location

likes.liked: — It was great in location to everthing!

reviews.text: What a lucky find! While driving through the park, we stopped in Sequim for accommodations and were really disappointed and decided to drive a little further. We happened upon the Lake Crescent Lodge, just 1 week from closing down for the season. We were offered a fantastic rate, and chose a room in the old motor lodge style. It was pouring rain the whole time, but we hiked to the nearby waterfall anyway, and it was definitely worth it.
reviews.title: Great Location - but ecological?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't spend much time in the room, but preferred to sit by the huge warm fire in the main lodge reading until it was time for dinner. We also used the wireless internet. Dinner was pretty good - not great for vegetarians - but they accommodated us. Breakfast was also good and all the staff was really friendly.
reviews.title: Come for the outstanding scenery

reviews.text: We found LCL while exploring the peninsula last year and fell in love while just walking around the cozy lodge and surroundings! There were no availabilities at the time of course but we were determined to come back for a visit. This year we stayed 2 nights/3days and had a wonderful time in the Singer Tavern cottages. Simple, sweet decor with 2 comfy queen beds and full BR. We actually jumped up and down and squealed with joy when we opened the door. (We don't get away enough..lol). So cozy, quaint, and clean...and close to the main lodge. We were able to bring our mini schnauzer too...thank you soooo much for being dog friendly! Renting kayaks was an easy task and the staff was so friendly....using our first names like we were old friends...so nice! It was our 1st time kayaking and we elected to venture out by ourselves vs using guides. The kayaks were very easy to maneuver and so much fun!! The hike to Marymere Falls was a lovely trek right off from the lodge and fun to explore. We brought a cooler and lots of snacks to help keep costs down...something I would recommend especially if bringing kids. We ate a couple of meals in the sunroom...the lounge food being more our style. Both of my teenage sons loved the fish n chips and crab cake croissant. The little coffee pot in our room was much appreciated in the mornings:) Sitting in a lounge chair with a cocktail watching the sunset was a slice of heaven for me! Staying at the LCL is well worth the extra cost when comparing it to a dismal stay at the Port Angeles Red Lion. The lodge is a perfect place to escape and relax. It was painful to leave...and we're definitely coming back!!
reviews.title: A Slice of Heaven!!

reviews.text: This lodge campus is awesome. Just being here is fantastic, and staying here is even better.
reviews.title: Highlight of the Olympic Peninsula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first, I was a little apprehensive about staying in the Marymere rooms, because some of the pictures online look like a beat up motel with floral polyester comforters. That is no longer the case. The room was updated with modern fixtures and fairly nice bedding. Yes, the bathroom is a bit small, but that would be quite hard to change. There's no TV in the rooms, and there's only wifi in the main lodge.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location, so-so accomodations

reviews.text: Forget all that, though. You're not here for the room; you're here for the scenery! Wow. The best views are in the early morning as the clouds just hang over the lake. The lake is cool (not quite 60 degrees in August), but it's crystal clear. Nighttime is dark... very dark. There seem to be 4x as many stars in the sky.
reviews.title: OK place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marymere falls isn't too far away either. From near the entrance of the resort area, there's a trail that snakes back into the woods. It's worth a 30 minute hike each way. The trail and falls are beautiful.
reviews.title: Relax by the Lake takes one back in Time

reviews.text: Lake Crescent Lodge was a wonderful experience. Great staff, excellent restaurant, comfortable accommodations in a beautiful surrounding. Rachel was especially nice, guiding us on a walking tour to Marymere Falls, and a kayaking tour of the magnificent lake.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were lucky enough to snare a cabin next to the lodge. Two queen beds, very comfy, lovely porch looking at the lake, and great short hikes. The lodge has boats to rent, great restraint, not cheap, and wifi in lodge lobby. Sat on the beach and watched the sun set between the mountains. No tv in rooms...which was fine with us.
reviews.title: A Beautiful place to stay!

reviews.text: I was here about 16 years ago and to this day it still makes an impression on me. I was just a teenage when I went as a family trip and I thought it was such a beautiful place. Years later I still talk about this Lodge. I would really love to take my husband there for a romantical get away. I remember the staff being very friendly and talked to my parents about our travels there, where we were from etc. I believe we rented these water bike things, I remember being excited and scared all at the same time! I would really love to go back and hopefully soon!
reviews.title: I want to go back

reviews.text: The Lake Crescent Lodge has a beautiful setting on the south bank of Lake Crescent in Olympic National Park. Great hikes out of your front door, kayaking and canoeing on the lake, tasty meals and a simple but pleasant lodge lobby are available - lots of people playing games with family members.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting, modest accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But don't expect luxury here - the rooms are all rather modest but clean and adequate. But this is all about the setting and the beauty of the park. I'll return if I have the chance.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Perfect View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to spend a long weekend in the Olympic National Park and decided to divide our time between Lake Quinault Lodge (two nights) and Crescent Lake Resort (one night). Both places are rustic. Lake Quinault lodge is the less rustic of the two in that it has a TV in the room (no TV, no phone at Lake Crescent) but Lake Crescent was by far the better choice for us.
reviews.title: What a view!

likes.liked: — The great view from our cabin.

reviews.text: At Lake Crescent we had a cabin by the lake, actually right on the lake. The view from our cabin was incredible. We were very pleased with the cabin, however, there are a few things to keep in mind: First, as mentioned above, no TV, no phones. The cabins are old and rustic, if that's not you then you won't enjoy staying in the cabins. Our cabin had plenty of room but it was actually half of a cabin, a duplex type of arrangement. I understand that not all cabins are this way (I guess ours could be rented by a large group and they could open up the inner door). Our bathroom was huge but rather basic; shower only, no tub.
reviews.title: Pretty lakeview

reviews.text: Dinner in the restaurant: our dinner was fine. Breakfast the next day was also fine. Neither were anything special but that wasn't a problem for us.
reviews.title: Loved the Lake Crescent Lodge!

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that we arrived early with the intention of dropping our luggage and then taking the car and going for a hike. Didn't want to leave the luggage in the car while it was parked in the forest. Unfortunately they won't hold luggage.
reviews.title: A Great Lodge in a Terrific Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Marymere room. Like other National Park lodges, it is dated. If you can accept this, you will probably like the room. We stayed in an end unit and could hear our neighbors slightly though the walls. The bathroom is tiny. We had a view of the lake out one side (beautiful, clear lake), and a wooded/parking lot view out the other side. There is a small patio with 2 chairs for lakeside and sunset views (not private though). The restaurant at the lodge had good food, but again, like other National Park lodges, it is quite pricey. The restaurant didn't open early enough for breakfast for our tastes (not until 730a). The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. We couldn't check in early so we took a hike to the Marymere Falls about a mile away - it was a nice hike with very pretty falls, and you can hit the trailhead from the lodge grounds.
reviews.title: What a view!

likes.liked: — The great view from our cabin.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lake Crescent Lodge for 3 nights in early September 2007. We chose the Lodge as a base for exploring Olympic National Park for a couple days.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring ONP; location is amazing and serene

reviews.text: We were stunned at the beauty of the place upon our arrival. It was so serene and calm. The location simply cannot be beat. One of our goals was to have a place where we could wake up in the morning and sit on the porch and have a cup of coffee while taking in the scenery, then come back after a day of hiking and enjoy a drink or a glass of wine on the porch while taking in the scenery again. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Nice cozy lodge

likes.disliked: — Bathroom down the hall but it was no biggie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the Storm King rooms. It was perfect for our purposes. Everything was in working order and was clean. Of course, the room is small and there is only a shower (no tub). But we were not expecting luxury. Folks who are expecting a huge, five-star room and lots of in-room amenities will be disappointed.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The historic lodge is a nice place to relax in the evening, looking at the books or having a glass of wine and hanging out.
reviews.title: Beautiful, serene setting

likes.liked: — The beauty and serenity of the surroundings
likes.disliked: — Distance from other services; very basic accommodations.

reviews.text: My only regret is that we didn't have more time to poke around the grounds, maybe rent a paddleboat on the lake, or just sit by the lake. But we were too busy exploring the rest of Olympic National Park!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

description: Lodge located in the Olympic Peninsula on the shore of Lake Crescent.
